advice.translation[0].definitions[0].def: an opinion you give someone about what they should do
advice.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: You should have followed my advice.
I need some advice about my computer.
On her doctor’s advice  (=because her doctor advised her) Smith decided to take early retirement.
advice.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: give somebody some advice
My father once gave me some useful advice.
The scheme has given advice and training to scores of youngsters taking part.
get some advice
I decided to get some advice from a specialist.
ask somebody’s advice
Can I ask your advice about something?
ask for advice
If in doubt, always ask for advice.
take/follow somebody’s advice
He followed his doctor’s advice and went on a low-fat diet.
The king acted on his advice and ordered his soldiers to get ready for battle.
listen to somebody’s advice
I wish I had listened to her advice.
ignore/disregard somebody’s advice
The accident happened because she ignored their advice.
go/turn to somebody for advice
People often go to him for advice about their problems.
seek advice
If you have any of these symptoms you should seek urgent advice.
offer advice
They can offer advice to those who wish to quit drinking.
pass on some advice
Readers can pass on advice about gardening.
good/excellent/useful/helpful
The book is full of good advice.
I thought that this was sound advice.
Unfortunately all the advice they gave me was wrong.
bad advice
Financial advisors can be fined if they give bad advice to a client.
practical advice
The programme aims to offer practical advice on healthy eating.
detailed advice
The website gives detailed advice about making bombs.
professional/expert/specialist advice
It’s advisable to get professional advice before starting any building work.
legal/medical/financial etc advice
Good legal advice can be expensive.
independent/impartial advice
The banks claim to offer independent financial advice.
conflicting advice
I’ve asked several people, and they’ve all given me conflicting advice.
a piece of advice
Let me give you a piece of advice.
a word of advice
A word of advice: look at the small print in the contract very carefully.
advice + NOUN
an advice centre/service/desk/bureau
They offer a 24-hour advice service to customers.
advice.translation[0].note_box[1].items[: You give someone some advice     Advice is an uncountable noun and cannot be used in the plural
My father gave me some good advice
You give someone a piece of advice
My father gave me a piece of good advice
My father gave me a good tip
Tip is a countable noun and can be used in the plural
Don’t confuse the noun advice  /ədˈvaɪs/ with the verb advise  /ədˈvaɪz/ You say
advice.translation[0].note_box[2].sectio: an opinion that is given to someone about what they should do
His advice was to give up smoking.
a simple but useful piece of advice about the best way to do something
advice about what to do, usually given by an expert or a group of people who have studied the matter
one of the major recommendations of the report
helpful general advice, especially about what to do in your life, your work etc
Young people need guidance from their parents.
advice.translation[1].definitions[0].def: information given to someone, especially by an expert, so that they know what to do and can make the right decision
advice.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: She will remain on the board and provide financial advice to the company.
a law firm specialising in providing legal advice to technology & IT industries
advice.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a document giving someone details about a sale or purchase that they are involved in, for example a note to a buyer giving details of goods that they are being sent
